Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "For Word Add-In" (#379) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Closed pull request "Add initial OfficeSchemaProcessor" (#362) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This handles packages.xsd transformations into C#. This is from the ooxml schema project and is part of an initial effort to bring that processing into the open SDK. This is a rewrite of it, but generates the same logical code, but in a much cleaner way. A subsequent PR will push updated generated code.

@tomjebo This change will also make it much easier to support Office 2016+ with minimal code churn (I've tested it with the Office 2016 packages.xsd and the changes are simple and easy to understand).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Support for converting textboxes in .docx  to html" (#196) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
I am using OpenXmlPowerTools 4.5.3.2 for my project to convert .docx files to html . I have found that the  textboxes within the .docx files are not being converted into html. Is this feature likely to be supported? 
I am doing this project as part of my organization requirement and most of the .docx files have textboxes and embedded data within the same which needs to be seen in the converted html .
I am using Visual Studio 2012 with Update 5 applied and have retrieved the OpenXMLPowertools library through NuGet. 

Also are any enhancements likely on making the html responsive?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DocumentBuilder doesn't handle multiple styles with the same style name but different IDs" (#181) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
**Observation 1**
When creating a document, `DocumentBuilder` merges styles by using the first style with a given ID from the list of sources. As an example, if source 1 and source 2 both specify a style with the ID `heading1`, the style from source 1 will be used.

**Observation 2**
When saving a document in a version of Word with a different display language than English, Word localizes the style IDs of built-in styles. However, it doesn't localize the style names. This leads to style XML like the following (from a Danish-language instance of Word):
```
<w:style w:type="paragraph" w:styleId="Overskrift1" xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main">
  <w:name w:val="heading 1" />
  <w:basedOn w:val="Normal" />
  <w:next w:val="Normal" />
  <w:link w:val="Overskrift1Tegn" />
  ...
</w:style>
```
**Observation 3**
When opening a document containing multiple (localized) styles with the same style name, Word deletes all but the last style, applying it to all elements that referenced one of the styles.

**Result**
Taken together, this means that `DocumentBuilder` seems to behave erratically with regards to style merging when building documents from sources saved in different language-versions of Word.

**Solution**
A possible solution would be to merge not only styles with the same ID, but also styles with the same name. This would mean that all references to one of the merged style would have to be changed to reference the ID of the "canonical" style.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Inline conditional not properly working" (#195) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, 
I need to make a sentence with the data i have in my XML, where some values should appear and some not. So I tried something like this:
XML:
<xml>
	<Condition1>true</Condition1>
    <Value1>5</Value1>
    <Condition2>true</Condition2>
    <Value2>5</Value2>
</xml>
DOCX:
<# <Conditional Select="./Condition1" Match="true"/> #>Value 1:<# <Content Select="./Value1"/> #><# <EndConditional/> #>,<# <Conditional Select="./Condition2" Match="true"/> #>Value 2:<# <Content Select="./Value2"/> #>.<# <EndConditional/> #>

When i open the returned file where it should be some values i get an id that is not anywhere in my xml.
Something like:
Value1 : a2d68399-ae3d-4374-a22c-737bc52ab9df, Value 2: a2d68399-ae3d-4374-a22c-737bc52ab9df
also condition1 was false so it shouldnt show anything.

If i wirte every line on different row it works great, but i get the resultant text in different rows.
Example:
<# <Conditional Select="./Condition1" Match="true"/> #>
Value 1:<# <Content Select="./Value1"/> #>
<# <EndConditional/> #>

How can i make this work as i want?
Sory for my bad english.
Thank you for the great work.
